column4: no better way to be a guru than to break stuff and fix it... i tell that to my students all the time
that's how I got to be such a linux goat
but seriously, I have run with FreeBSD for a while and that's how learned a lot of the stuff that I know now
and those backports might not be so unstable even as I thought, as I am reading more about it from here http://backports.ubuntuforums.org/
the backports and hoary aren't all that unstable if you ask me... I have had some problems with OpenOffice crashing but that's it

and I would have no problem with unstable app, what I meant was that I would not like it at all if there would come some weird dependency problems whatsoever which then would prevent me from using X or so on :D
they did good job scaring me first ;) but as I read more, I think that there is not that much to worry
I had when I upgraded warty to hoary :)
actually I DID have some problems with I enabled the nerim.net respositories
